meanings.definition: To flavor or preserve with brandy.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys brandying her desserts for a rich taste.
meanings.sent2: The chef is brandying the sauce to enhance its flavor.
meanings.sent3: The family joked that she was brandying everything in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of brandying filled the room, making mouths water.
meanings.sent5: He demonstrated brandying the fruits, making it look easy.

meanings.definition: The act of adding brandy to something.
meanings.sent1: The brandying of the cake gave it a unique taste.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of brandying from her grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The brandying of the punch bowl made the party more festive.
meanings.sent4: The brandying of the stew added a special touch to the dish.
meanings.sent5: The brandying of the cocktail was done with precision and care.

meanings.sent1: The brandying at the distillery was a meticulous task.
meanings.sent2: He studied the brandying process to become a master distiller.
meanings.sent3: The brandying of the spirits required patience and skill.
meanings.sent4: The brandying of the barrels produced high-quality brandy.
meanings.sent5: The brandying of the grapes marked the beginning of the distillation process.
